metadata.titel_preek: On Location with John the Baptist

primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God invades a world of sin and death to establish a new kingdom, preceded by the sentinel John the Baptist who marks the turn of the ages.

tekstueel_bewijs: God arrives in his world to turn it away from its past
The Lord of the universe is about to step on the stage of world history to reverse its course
God is on the move. He is creating a new humanity.

object.identificatie: The New World / Liberation / A New Humanity
tekstueel_bewijs: God’s coming kingdom of truth, liberty, and love
God’s new rule is made manifest

zender.identificatie: God the Father / The Scriptural Promise
tekstueel_bewijs: As it is written in Isaiah the prophet

ontvanger.identificatie: The World / The Hearers / The 'Least of These'
tekstueel_bewijs: You and I belong to it [the new humanity]
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: The hearer is positioned as a 'sentinel' or 'soldier' who receives the news of the invasion and is called to hold territory.

helper.identificatie: John the Baptist / Martyrs / The Church
tekstueel_bewijs: John’s whole life was lived with but one purpose; he was born... to declare the imminent arrival
These Christians were like John the Baptist. They stayed in their location in order to bear witness
helper.rol_van_god: God is the Primary Subject; Christ is the invading force.
helper.rol_van_geest: Implicit as the power enabling the 'holding of ground'.

tegenstander.identificatie: The Present Evil Age / Despots / Sin / Death
tekstueel_bewijs: this age of despotism, disease, and death
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is not merely bad habits but an 'age' of corruption and cosmic powers that require divine intervention to defeat.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The hearer must 'hold the ground' and 'bear fruit' as a response to the invasion of the primary program.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Hearer / The Christian
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The ethical 'holding of ground' is explicitly framed as a response to the fact that 'God is on the move'.

actantieel_schema_visualisatie.helper_subject_tegenstander: John the Baptist/Martyrs → God/Christ ← Present Evil Age

voorbeelden_god_subject: The Lord of the universe is about to step on the stage
He is creating a new humanity
voorbeelden_mens_subject: We should pause to honor these martyrs

voorbeelden: Prepare the way of the Lord
Wherever people are willing to come out
The only cure for such an age is the intervention of God
God is on the move... He is creating

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon emphasizes God's 'Pouvoir' (Power) to intervene in a world where humans are otherwise 'paralyzed' by fear.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: From S2 (Despotism) to ~S1 (Zombies) to ~S2 (Holding ground) to S1 (New Humanity).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved by the 'Invasion' of God which turns the ages.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Extremely high; the sermon uses graphic imagery of martyrdom and political despotism.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: While the sermon has strong ethical calls, they are grounded in the 'Apocalyptic' invasion of God. The human is not the savior, but the sentinel of a victory already initiated by God.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: he is a model for every Christian preacher

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: The only cure for such an age is the intervention of God.
this age of despotism, disease, and death

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: John the Baptist and modern martyrs are used as models of 'location' and 'witness'.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: The sermon avoids pure moralism by stating John's role was 'divinely ordained' and he points away from himself.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Empowerment through belonging to a 'new humanity' rather than pressure to create it.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from God's cosmic action to the hearer's daily ethics is seamless via the metaphor of 'holding territory'.
spanning_punten: The tension between the 'already' of God's move and the 'not yet' of the routine horrors.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: the invading Son of God... reverse the downward spiral of human history

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The sermon focuses more on the Christological 'Invasion' than the Pneumatological 'Indwelling'.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Critical; sin is seen as a 'present evil age' and 'despotism' that humans cannot escape alone.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is structurally sound, placing God as the Subject of the cosmic rescue and the human as the respondent.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: More emphasis on Pouvoir (the Spirit's power to hold the ground).
modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Explicitly mention how the Spirit provides the 'Pouvoir' to resist the 'Vouloir' of the old age.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: Maintain the current order: God's Invasion -> Our Location.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterclass in apocalyptic homiletics that avoids moralism by framing ethics as 'territory holding' in a war God is already winning.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: Rhetorical analysis would focus on the Belgrade/Zaire anecdotes; Greimas shows these function as 'Helpers' to the 'Subject' (God).
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains Mark 1; Greimas shows how the 'Location' of John becomes the 'Location' of the hearer through actantial substitution.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that the 'zombie' metaphor is a modal state of 'Non-Pouvoir' (inability) which only God's 'Pouvoir' can rectify.

appendices.notities: The sermon successfully follows Rutledge's rule by making God the subject of the primary salvific verbs.
